docs.lead_paragraph: For the first time since Monaco was founded in the 13th century, its royal family gave birth to twins on Wednesday, and dozens of cannons were fired to celebrate.

headline.main: Monaco's Princess Charlene Gives Birth to Twins
headline.print_headline: Monaco's Princess Charlene Gives Birth to Twins

docs.snippet: For the first time since Monaco was founded in the 13th century, its royal family gave birth to twins on Wednesday, and dozens of cannons were fired to celebrate.

docs.lead_paragraph: The task was never going to be easy: Fly four highly endangered rhinos from a Czech Republic zoo to East Africa, drive them to the savannah grasses of Mount Kenya and hope that the natural environment helps produce a calf, staving off extinction.

headline.main: Rhino Species to Die Unless Science Can Help
headline.print_headline: Rhino Species to Die Unless Science Can Help

docs.snippet: The task was never going to be easy: Fly four highly endangered rhinos from a Czech Republic zoo to East Africa, drive them to the savannah grasses of Mount Kenya and hope that the natural environment helps produce a calf, staving off extinction.

docs.lead_paragraph: Declaring early childhood education "one of the best investments we can make," President Barack Obama on Wednesday followed up on a promise to expand early education opportunities for tens of thousands of children by announcing $1 billion in public-private spending on programs for young learners.

headline.main: Obama Announces $1B for Early Childhood Education
headline.print_headline: Obama Announces $1B for Early Childhood Education

docs.snippet: Declaring early childhood education "one of the best investments we can make," President Barack Obama on Wednesday followed up on a promise to expand early education opportunities for tens of thousands of children by announcing $1 billion in...

docs.lead_paragraph: If you treat teenagers as if they’re responsible, they can live up to that.
docs.abstract: Pamela Druckerman Op-Ed article compares way that Americans and Europeans teach children about sex; notes that Europeans offer information to their children much earlier, and in more respectful way; reflects that Europeans' low teenage pregnancy rates seem to suggest that if one treats teenagers as if they are responsible, they will live up to that.
docs.snippet: If you treat teenagers as if they’re responsible, they can live up to that.

docs.lead_paragraph: A report raises questions about access to care for Medicaid beneficiaries; some listed doctors were not taking new patients, and others had long since left the location where they were listed.

headline.main: Half of Doctors Listed as Serving Medicaid Patients Are Unavailable, Investigation Finds
headline.print_headline: Half of Doctors Listed as Serving Medicaid Patients Are Unavailable, Investigation Finds

docs.abstract: Report by Health and Human Services Dept raises questions about access to care for Medicaid beneficiaries; says half of doctors listed as serving Medicaid patients are unavailable, and one-third are not even at their listed address.
docs.snippet: A report raises questions about access to care for Medicaid beneficiaries; some listed doctors were not taking new patients, and others had long since left the location where they were listed.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Increasing obesity rates, inactivity and older maternal age are contributing to the rise in hypertension and, consequently, strokes, experts say.

headline.main: Strokes Found Rising in Pregnant Women
headline.print_headline: Strokes Found Rising in Pregnant Women

docs.abstract: Study in journal Obstetrics & Gynecology finds stroke rate is rising rapidly among pregnant women, even as it is declining in Americans age 65 and older; contributing factors to hypertension and strokes include rising obesity rates, inactivity and older maternal age.
docs.snippet: Increasing obesity rates, inactivity and older maternal age are contributing to the rise in hypertension and, consequently, strokes, experts say.

headline.main: Antibiotics May Not Raise Asthma Risk

docs.abstract: A large Swedish study has found strong evidence that there is no connection between antibiotic use and the subsequent development of asthma.
docs.snippet: A large Swedish study has found strong evidence that there is no connection between antibiotic use and the subsequent development of asthma.
